tool.name: Tool

param.name: portal_url
param.dialogReference: URL of of the ArcGIS Online organization or the ArcGIS Enterprise portal.
param.pythonReference: URL of of the ArcGIS Online organization or the ArcGIS Enterprise portal.

param.name: portal_user
param.dialogReference: Username of an ArcGIS Online or ArcGIS Enteprise account with access to the group containing the maps that will be processed, and permissions that allow for edting the data in these layers.
param.pythonReference: Username of an ArcGIS Online or ArcGIS Enteprise account with access to the group containing the maps that will be processed, and permissions that allow for edting the data in these layers.

param.name: portal_password
param.dialogReference: Password corresponding to the provided username.
param.pythonReference: Password corresponding to the provided username.

param.name: cityworks_url
param.dialogReference: URL of the Cityworks connection.
param.pythonReference: URL of the Cityworks connection.

param.name: cityworks_user
param.dialogReference: Username for a Cityworks account that can access and edit the data in the database.
param.pythonReference: Username for a Cityworks account that can access and edit the data in the database.

param.name: cityworks_password
param.dialogReference: Password corresponding to the provided username.
param.pythonReference: Password corresponding to the provided username.

param.name: cityworks_cwol
param.dialogReference: Check if the Cityworks site uses CWOL authentication.
param.pythonReference: Check if the Cityworks site uses CWOL authentication.

param.name: group
param.expression: Provide ArcGIS credentials to see group list
param.dialogReference: Group in the ArcGIS Online organization or ArcGIS Enterprise portal of the maps with editable layers containing the data to be transferred. Only groups in the provided organization/portal and accessible to the provided ArcGIS account are presented.
param.pythonReference: Group in the ArcGIS Online organization or ArcGIS Enterprise portal of the maps with editable layers containing the data to be transferred. Only groups in the provided organization/portal and accessible to the provided ArcGIS account are presented.

param.name: layers
param.expression: Provide credentials and select a group to see field list
param.dialogReference: Editable feature layers found in the maps that are shared with the selected group. Layers must have Update capabilities and must have at least one editable field in the popup to be listed. Layers that are found in multiple maps are only listed once.
param.pythonReference: Editable feature layers found in the maps that are shared with the selected group. Layers must have Update capabilities and must have at least one editable field in the popup to be listed. Layers that are found in multiple maps are only listed once.

param.expression: Select layers to see field list
param.dialogReference: Field in the ArcGIS layers for the open (init) date of each request. This field must be present in all ArcGIS layers selected for processing.
param.pythonReference: Field in the ArcGIS layers for the open (init) date of each request. This field must be present in all ArcGIS layers selected for processing.

param.name: flag_field
param.expression: Provide credentials and select a group to see field list
param.dialogReference: Field in the ArcGIS layers used to indicate when a report has been transferred to Cityworks. Thsi field must exist in all ArcGIS layers and tables selected for processing.
param.pythonReference: Field in the ArcGIS layers used to indicate when a report has been transferred to Cityworks. Thsi field must exist in all ArcGIS layers and tables selected for processing.

param.name: flag_on
param.dialogReference: Value in the flag field that indicates the report has not been transferred to Cityworks.
param.pythonReference: Value in the flag field that indicates the report has not been transferred to Cityworks.

param.name: flag_off
param.dialogReference: Value in the flag field that indicates the report has been transferred to Cityworks.
param.pythonReference: Value in the flag field that indicates the report has been transferred to Cityworks.

param.name: feature_fields
param.dialogReference: Map of additional ArcGIS feature fields and their corresponding Cityworks fields. All ArcGIS fields must be present in all ArcGIS fields selected for processing.
param.pythonReference: Map of additional ArcGIS feature fields and their corresponding Cityworks fields. All ArcGIS fields must be present in all ArcGIS fields selected for processing.

param.name: tables
param.expression: {Provide credentials and select a group to see table list}
param.dialogReference: Editable table layers found in the maps that are shared with the selected group. Tables that do not participate in a relationship wiht a selected feature layer will not be processed. Tables must have at least one editable field in the popup to be listed. Tables that are found in multiple maps are only listed once.
param.pythonReference: Editable table layers found in the maps that are shared with the selected group. Tables that do not participate in a relationship wiht a selected feature layer will not be processed. Tables must have at least one editable field in the popup to be listed. Tables that are found in multiple maps are only listed once.

param.name: comment_fields
param.dialogReference: Map of additional ArcGIS table fields and their corresponding Cityworks fields. All ArcGIS fields must be present in all ArcGIS fields selected for processing.
param.pythonReference: Map of additional ArcGIS table fields and their corresponding Cityworks fields. All ArcGIS fields must be present in all ArcGIS fields selected for processing.

param.name: configuration_path
param.dialogReference: Output path where the configuration file will be stored. This configuration file can be used as input when running or scheduling the connect_to_cityworks.py script.
param.pythonReference: Output path where the configuration file will be stored. This configuration file can be used as input when running or scheduling the connect_to_cityworks.py script.

tool.summary: This tool creates a configuration file that can be used to transfer data between ArcGIS feature layers (ArcGIS Online or ArcGIS Enterprise) and a Cityworks database. It is designed to work with point data collected through Citizen Problem Reporter applications.
tool.usage:
This tool requires the following:

  • An account in an ArcGIS Online organization or an ArcGIS Enterprise portal.

    • This account must have access to a group that contains the maps that are being used for data collection, and must be able to edit the layers in these maps.

    • Editable layers in these maps are eligible for a connection to Cityworks. Layer must have Update capabilities, and must have at least one editable field in the popup even though data from uneditable fields may be transferred to cityworks.

    • Fields in these layers containing information to be transferred to Cityworks must have the same names accross layers.

    • Layers containing information to be transferred to Cityworks must contain a field to track which features have been transferred.

    • Layers containing information to be transferred to Cityworks must contain a field to store the Request ID generated by Cityworks.

    • The values in the field that tracks the request type must correspond exactly with the request type values expected by Cityworks.

  • A Cityworks account.
